previous_goals.goal: i think i just take forever to fall asleep i think turn them off an hour before i want to go to sleep and i want to work on this for 4 weeks

measurable.issue: No metric to track success - doesn't specify how to measure if falling asleep is improving or what 'taking forever' means

analysis.suggestions: Add a measurable outcome, such as: 'Turn off screens 1 hour before bedtime to fall asleep within 30 minutes (instead of current 60+ minutes) for 4 weeks, tracking nightly in a sleep journal.'

smart_analysis.suggestions: Add a measurable outcome, such as: 'Turn off screens 1 hour before bedtime to fall asleep within 30 minutes (instead of current 60+ minutes) for 4 weeks, tracking nightly in a sleep journal.'

new_goals: 3 times maybe and 1 hour each tuesday, thursday, friday i just kinda want to walk around
session_data.current_goal: 3 times maybe and 1 hour each tuesday, thursday, friday i just kinda want to walk around

specific.issue: The action 'just kinda want to walk around' is too vague - doesn't specify what type of walking (brisk walk, casual stroll, specific route, indoor/outdoor)

timebound.issue: While days are specified (Tuesday, Thursday, Friday), there's confusion with '3 times maybe' which conflicts with the three specific days, and no end date or duration commitment (e.g., 'for 4 weeks')

analysis.suggestions: Revise to: 'Walk briskly for 1 hour, 3 times per week on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday for the next 4 weeks' - this removes the uncertainty of 'maybe' and 'kinda', specifies the type of walking, and adds a clear timeframe for the commitment.

goal_smart_analysis.suggestions: Revise to: 'Walk briskly for 1 hour, 3 times per week on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday for the next 4 weeks' - this removes the uncertainty of 'maybe' and 'kinda', specifies the type of walking, and adds a clear timeframe for the commitment.

session_data.last_coach_response: Perfect, setting alarms is a solid way to stay on track. Would you like to set another goal for this week?

conversation_history.content: [START_SESSION]
Hi Jade, it's great to see you again! How was your week?
good
That's good to hear. So, how did it go with turning off your screens an hour before you wanted to go to sleep?
went well
That's wonderful! I'm glad it went well for you. On a scale of 1 to 10, how stressed were you this week?
I hear you, that's a really high stress level. What's been going on that's made this week so stressful for you?
i have finals week coming up

Finals week can definitely bring a lot of stress. So thinking about next week, what would you like to focus on for your goals? You have three options: keep working on the same screen time goal, keep that goal and add a new one to help with finals stress, or switch to completely new goals. What sounds most helpful to you right now?
switch completely
That makes sense given what you're dealing with right now. What would you like to focus on instead to help you get through finals week?
I want to play pokemon go for stress relief
Playing Pokemon Go sounds like a great way to get some stress relief and movement. How much time do you want to spend playing it, and how often during the week?
3 times maybe and 1 hour each
Got it, so 3 times a week for 1 hour each time. Which days were you thinking of doing this? That way we can make sure it fits with your finals schedule.
Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

Perfect, so you want to play Pokemon Go for 1 hour on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. Just to make sure I understand correctly, where were you planning to play? Like around campus, in a specific area, or does it matter?
I just kinda want to walk around

Okay, so walking around while playing Pokemon Go. Let me make sure I have this right: You want to spend 1 hour walking around playing Pokemon Go on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays. Is that accurate, or did I miss anything?
correct
Great, thank you for confirming. On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident are you that you can achieve this goal of walking around playing Pokemon Go for 1 hour on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays?
That's really high confidence, which is great to see! How are you planning to remember or track when you've done your walks each week?
ill set alarms
Perfect, setting alarms is a solid way to stay on track. Would you like to set another goal for this week?
no
Great work today, Jade! You'll be working on your walking goal three times a week for an hour each on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. I'll see you next week at Session 3. Take care!
